cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 600 miles southwest of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then accelerating northeast toward the Florida Panhandle; forecast to sweep across Georgia/South Carolina and move into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida Panhandle coast between Apalachicola and St. Marks

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch east of the Ochlockonee River to Yankeetown, FL (Big Bend Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Mississippi/Alabama border to the Ochlockonee River, FL and Grand Isle, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the Florida Panhandle, then inland across GA/SC to the Carolinas and western Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Occasional squalls with sustained winds 20–30 mph and gusts to 35 mph possible late Friday into Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None significant expected on the east-central Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated 5 inch pockets Friday night–Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the Atlantic beaches
